required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of CCNU (Lomustine) Plus Dasatinib in Recurrent Glioblastoma (GBM)
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Phase II of Lomustine Versus Lomustine-Dasatinib in Patients With Recurrent Glioblastoma

collaborator.agency: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer - EORTC

brief_summary.textblock: To determine whether dasatinib plus lomustine are effective for treatment of recurrent glioblastoma

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious AEs (SAEs), Deaths, and Discontinuations Due to AEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline, every 2 weeks during cycles 1-6 (6-week cycles), and every 6 weeks after cycle 6. Median number of cycles = 1.0 (range: 1.0 - 7.0).
primary_outcome.description: SAE=any untoward medical event that results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency or abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation. AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a preexisting medical condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Treatment-related(Tx-R)=certainly, probably, possibly related and unknown relationship to study drug. AE grades(Gr) 1=Mild; 2=Moderate; 3=Severe; 4=Life-threatening.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Dose-limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: The duration for observation of DLT was 2 6-week cycles in participants with escalated dose (QD to BID) and 1 6 -week cycle for participants starting with BID regime. For participants receiving dasatinib at 150 mg, DLTs were only documented over cycle 1.
primary_outcome.description: Grades (gr) according to National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE), version 3.0. DLTs were defined as adverse drug reactions as follows: absolute neutrophil counts <0.5x10^9/L (gr4) lasting for 7 consecutive days; febrile neutropenia (neutrophil count <1x10^9/L and fever of >=38.5°C); thrombocytopenia (gr4); any gr3/4 nonhematological toxicity except nausea, vomiting and fever which could be rapidly controlled with appropriate measures; any toxicity which did not allow administering at least 70% of the intended dose intensity for both agents.

primary_outcome.measure: Deaths Within 30 Days of Protocol Treatment Discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization through within 30 days after protocol treatment discontinuation. Median (full range) number of 6-week treatment cycles was 1.0 (1.0-7.0).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Worst Grade of Hematological Toxicity Per NCI CTCAE Version 3.0 Criteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline, every 2 weeks during cycles 1-6 (6-week cycles), and every 6 weeks after cycle 6. Median number of cycles = 1.0 (range: 1.0 - 7.0).
primary_outcome.description: Neutrophils (neutropenia): Grade (gr)1 <LLN-1500/mm3; Gr2 <1500-1000/mm3; Gr3 <1000-500/mm3; Gr4 <500/mm3. Leukocytes (leukopenia): Gr1 <LLN-3000/mm3; Gr2 <3000-2000/mm3; Gr3 <2000-1000/mm3; Gr4 <1000/mm3. Lymphocytes (lymphocytopenia): Gr1 <LLN-800/mm3; Gr2 <800-500/mm3; Gr3 <500-200/mm3; Gr4 <200/mm3. Platelets (thrombocytopenia): Gr1 <LLN-75,000/mm3; Gr2 <75,000-50,000/mm3; Gr3 <50,000-25,000/mm3; Gr4 <25,000/mm3. Hemoglobin (anemia): Gr1 <LLN-10.0 g/dL; Gr2 <10.0-8.0 g/dL; Gr3 <8.0-6.5 g/dL; Gr4 <6.5 g/dL. LLN/ULN=lower/upper limit of normal (normal ranges may vary by local laboratories).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Worst Grade of Biochemistry Abnormality Per NCI CTCAE Version 3.0 Criteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline, every 2 weeks during cycles 1-6 (6-week cycles), and every 6 weeks after 6 cycles. Median number of cycles = 1.0 (range: 1.0 - 7.0).
primary_outcome.description: Grades (gr) 1=mild; gr2=moderate; gr3=severe; gr4=life-threatening. For details of NCI CTCAE laboratory values for each grade, please refer to http://ctep.cancer.gov/protocolDevelopment/electronic_applications/ctc.htm#ctc_30. Low Potassium=Hypokalemia, High Potassium=Hyperkalemia, Low Sodium=Hyponatremia, Low Calcium=Hypocalcemia, High Bilirubin=Hyperbilirubinemia, low phosphatase=Hypophosphatemia, Low Potassium=Hypokalemia.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Disease Progression at 12 Months
other_outcome.description: As measured by brain magnetic resonance imaging.

intervention.description: Tablets, Oral, 100 mg, Once or Twice daily (depending on safety cohort), Until progression or toxicity
Tablets, Oral, 110 mg/m², Every 6 weeks, until progression or toxicity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with histological or cytological proven glioblastoma multiforme
- Recurrent or progressive disease documented by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)
- World Health Organization (WHO) Performance status 0 - 2
- Patient may have been operated for recurrence
- For non operated patients, recurrent disease must be at least one bidimensionally measurable target lesion with one diameter of at least 2cm
- Patients must be on a stable or decreasing dose of corticosteroids for at least 1 week prior to baseline MRI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with histological or cytological proven glioblastoma multiforme
- Completion of radiotherapy to the brain less than 3 months prior to registration/randomization
- Prior treatment with high dose radiotherapy, stereotactic radiosurgery or internal radiation therapy
- Previous or current malignancy at other sites within prior 3 years

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 28 participants enrolled in this study, 26 received treatment.

group.title: Dasatinib, 100 mg QD/100 mg BID + Lomustine, 110 mg/m^2
group.description: Dose level 1A. Cycle 1: Dasatinib, 100 mg once daily (QD). Cycle 2: Dasatinib, 100 mg twice daily (BID), plus lomustine, 110 mg/m^2.

group.description: Dose level 1B. Cycle 1: Dasatinib,100 mg QD. Cycle 2: 100 mg BID, plus lomustine, 90 mg/m^2.

group.description: Dasatinib: 100 mg/day (QD) + CCNU: 90 mg/m²

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: ECOG criteria is used to assess disease progression and affects on daily living abilities and to determine appropriate treatment and prognosis. Grade 0=normal activity; Grade 1=Restricted physical activity but ambulatory and capable of light work; Grade 2=Ambulatory, capable of self care, but unable to carry out any work activities; Grade 3=Capable of limited self care, confined to bed or chair 50% or more of waking hours; Grade 4=Completely disabled, totally confined to bed or chair.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Dose-limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
outcome.description: Grades (gr) according to National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE), version 3.0. DLTs were defined as adverse drug reactions as follows: absolute neutrophil counts <0.5x10^9/L (gr4) lasting for 7 consecutive days; febrile neutropenia (neutrophil count <1x10^9/L and fever of >=38.5°C); thrombocytopenia (gr4); any gr3/4 nonhematological toxicity except nausea, vomiting and fever which could be rapidly controlled with appropriate measures; any toxicity which did not allow administering at least 70% of the intended dose intensity for both agents.
outcome.time_frame: The duration for observation of DLT was 2 6-week cycles in participants with escalated dose (QD to BID) and 1 6 -week cycle for participants starting with BID regime. For participants receiving dasatinib at 150 mg, DLTs were only documented over cycle 1.
outcome.population: Evaluable Participants: subset of participants used to decide on dose escalations. Participants were assessable if they completed the period for DLT observation.

DLTs were defined as adverse drug reactions as follows: absolute neutrophil counts <0.5x10^9/L (gr4) lasting for 7 consecutive days; febrile neutropenia (neutrophil count <1x10^9/L and fever of >=38.5°C); thrombocytopenia (gr4); any gr3/4 nonhematological toxicity except nausea, vomiting and fever which could be rapidly controlled with appropriate measures; any toxicity which did not allow administering at least 70% of the intended dose intensity for both agents.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Worst Grade of Hematological Toxicity Per NCI CTCAE Version 3.0 Criteria
outcome.description: Neutrophils (neutropenia): Grade (gr)1 <LLN–1500/mm3; Gr2 <1500–1000/mm3; Gr3 <1000–500/mm3; Gr4 <500/mm3. Leukocytes (leukopenia): Gr1 <LLN–3000/mm3; Gr2 <3000–2000/mm3; Gr3 <2000–1000/mm3; Gr4 <1000/mm3. Lymphocytes (lymphocytopenia): Gr1 <LLN–800/mm3; Gr2 <800–500/mm3; Gr3 <500–200/mm3; Gr4 <200/mm3. Platelets (thrombocytopenia): Gr1 <LLN–75,000/mm3; Gr2 <75,000–50,000/mm3; Gr3 <50,000–25,000/mm3; Gr4 <25,000/mm3. Hemoglobin (anemia): Gr1 <LLN–10.0 g/dL; Gr2 <10.0–8.0 g/dL; Gr3 <8.0–6.5 g/dL; Gr4 <6.5 g/dL. LLN/ULN=lower/upper limit of normal (normal ranges may vary by local laboratories).
outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline, every 2 weeks during cycles 1-6 (6-week cycles), and every 6 weeks after cycle 6. Median number of cycles = 1.0 (range: 1.0 - 7.0).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Worst Grade of Hematological Toxicity Per NCI CTCAE Version 3.0 Criteria
measure.description: Neutrophils (neutropenia): Grade (gr)1 <LLN–1500/mm3; Gr2 <1500–1000/mm3; Gr3 <1000–500/mm3; Gr4 <500/mm3. Leukocytes (leukopenia): Gr1 <LLN–3000/mm3; Gr2 <3000–2000/mm3; Gr3 <2000–1000/mm3; Gr4 <1000/mm3. Lymphocytes (lymphocytopenia): Gr1 <LLN–800/mm3; Gr2 <800–500/mm3; Gr3 <500–200/mm3; Gr4 <200/mm3. Platelets (thrombocytopenia): Gr1 <LLN–75,000/mm3; Gr2 <75,000–50,000/mm3; Gr3 <50,000–25,000/mm3; Gr4 <25,000/mm3. Hemoglobin (anemia): Gr1 <LLN–10.0 g/dL; Gr2 <10.0–8.0 g/dL; Gr3 <8.0–6.5 g/dL; Gr4 <6.5 g/dL. LLN/ULN=lower/upper limit of normal (normal ranges may vary by local laboratories).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Worst Grade of Biochemistry Abnormality Per NCI CTCAE Version 3.0 Criteria
outcome.description: Grades (gr) 1=mild; gr2=moderate; gr3=severe; gr4=life-threatening. For details of NCI CTCAE laboratory values for each grade, please refer to http://ctep.cancer.gov/protocolDevelopment/electronic_applications/ctc.htm#ctc_30. Low Potassium=Hypokalemia, High Potassium=Hyperkalemia, Low Sodium=Hyponatremia, Low Calcium=Hypocalcemia, High Bilirubin=Hyperbilirubinemia, low phosphatase=Hypophosphatemia, Low Potassium=Hypokalemia.
outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline, every 2 weeks during cycles 1-6 (6-week cycles), and every 6 weeks after 6 cycles. Median number of cycles = 1.0 (range: 1.0 - 7.0).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
